trans.ptxt: MIG brazed joint locations for high-strength steel ( MPa) parts are specified in the part installation instructions contained in section "Replacement". Observe the following conditions to ensure adequate joint strength.

item.ptxt: MAG welding temperatures reach approximately 째C ( 째F), which may compromise the internal structure and high-strength steel parts. MIG brazing is used because it is done at a much lower temperature, approximately 째C ( 째F), that won't affect the structure or strength of high-strength steel ( MPa) parts.
Avoid MAG welding for high-strength steel ( MPa) parts.

trans.ptxt: NOTE: To prevent decreased joint strength, don't grind a MIG braze to a structural part.

fig-text-grp.ptxt: If a high-strength steel ( MPa) part is being brazed to a high-strength structural steel part ( MPa or higher). Open holes of diameter mm ( in) with approximately mm ( in) distance (distance between the centers of holes) for brazing.

trans.title: MIG Brazing to Outer (Mild Steel) Panels

trans.ptxt: NOTE: For a better appearance, MIG braze joints to an outer panel may be ground smooth.

fig-text-grp.ptxt: If a high-strength steel ( MPa) part is being brazed to MPa part (mild steel plate) such as the outer panel, drill one hole of diameter mm ( in) on the MPa plate.
